meanings.sent1: The wealthy landowner owned a vast latifundium.
meanings.sent2: The latifundium stretched as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent3: The latifundium was so big, it took the farmer a whole day to walk from one end to the other.
meanings.sent4: Her latifundium was like a kingdom of crops and livestock.
meanings.sent5: The latifundium was a green paradise in the midst of the dry desert.

meanings.definition: A system of land ownership and farming prevalent in ancient Rome and other societies
meanings.sent1: The latifundium system allowed for efficient farming on a large scale.
meanings.sent2: In ancient Rome, the latifundium system was crucial for food production.
meanings.sent3: The latifundium system made farming look like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent4: Under the latifundium system, the land was divided among the workers for cultivation.
meanings.sent5: The latifundium system transformed the countryside into a productive landscape.
